intro: Solidago laxa, commonly known as the lax goldenrod, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features tall, slender stems covered in fine, hairy hairs, and its leaves are lance-shaped with serrated edges. It produces clusters of yellow flowers in late summer to early autumn, which attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Solidago laxa thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and prairies.
